data.title: Proposed Rules – NYC Rules
data.meta_description: Every year, City agencies make over 100 changes or additions to the City rules that are an important part of how government interacts with the public. New Yorkers can review proposed rules and voice their opinions about those rules before they are adopted into law.
data.text:
To change the text size on NYC.gov you can use your web browser’s settings. Most browsers include functionality to let you increase or decrease the text on a web page. For example, to increase text size using:

Chrome

In the menu to the right of the address bar, select and set Zoom level. Menu > Zoom > +

Firefox

In the View menu, select Zoom. View > Zoom > Zoom In

Internet Explorer

In the View menu, select Text Size. View > Text Size > Largest

Safari

In the View menu, select Zoom In. View > Zoom In Macintosh Shortcut: Command+

No Web Browser Endorsement

Common browsers are included in this page; mention of a specific browser does not imply endorsement or recommendation.

To comment on a proposed rule, click on the “Add new comment” links next to the rules below. Comments may be submitted until the date indicated in the “Comment Deadline” column.

You must submit your name and email in order to leave a comment (your email address will not be published with your comment). Your comment will be reviewed for spam before it is posted on the site and may take up to one full business day to be displayed. See Comment & Posting Policy.

If you do not wish your personal information, such as email or mailing address, or phone number, to appear in the published comment, please do not include it in your comment. The email provided in the field to submit the comment will not be displayed.

City agencies also accept comments by mail, fax, or email. Click on a proposed rule below for instructions on alternate ways to submit comments.
